title: Usually lovely, but if it’s busy...I wouldn’t bother
text: Arrived in new quay on good Friday (very sunny and busy) however walked over at 12.30 and by then there were no pasties left and the lady working there rudely mentioned that she wasn’t turning the ovens on again for the remainder of the day. Very disappointing as they’ve been shut all this time and was this not a golden opportunity? In the five minutes we stood outside lots of people turned away also

title: Lovely food and drinks but absolutely ROASTING
text: Had a really nice meal and lovely 2 4 1 cocktails there however it was 30° on the day we went and they sat us on a table next to a boiling hot radiator! Unfortunately they couldn’t turn it off and couldn’t move us for a while so it was a very very hot and uncomfortable few hours. Staff are very friendly and atmosphere is great though :)

title: Absolutely Sensational!
text: My family and I have visited here many times and have never had a bad experience, in fact we’ve never had an average experience it is always fantastic in there! Food is amazing, staff are lovely and be sure to go when there is live music on in there as that is always very fun! A must go, 1000% recommend!

title: Amazing - a must go!
text: Absolutely amazing here and the mussels and chips were sensational! We had mussels a la creme (9 euros), a side of chips (4.50 euro as they dont come with the mussels) and a bottle of wine for 24 euros so its very good value for money! Would definitely recommend! great service too!

title: Amazing - a must go!
text: Amazing to see all the traditional houses in the village and its actually really big! Very cheap admission and definitely worth a visit! a little far from the old town however Uber is very cheap there

title: Eye-opening - a must go
text: Very honest and eye-opening experience to go to see this memorial with the exhibition underground - so many things to learn and its all very well presented - definitely recommend.
place: The Holocaust Memorial - Memorial to the Murdered Jews of Europe

title: Amazing - a must go!
text: So pretty and the views are lovely. A must visit in Florence and you can see al the lovely famous jewellery for sale. a must-visit!

title: Amazing - a must go!
text: So pretty in there and its very big! Free admission when you buy a combined ticket to the other attractions - would definitely recommend!

title: Amazing - a must go!
text: Super quick service, had the Vespa for 50 euros in 10 minutes and the staff were friendly and helpful, we had an amazing day and i would definitely recommend
place: Full-Day Vespa and Scooter Rental in Rome

title: Amazing - a must go!
text: A definite highlight of my trip - absolutely amazing up there! there is also a water fountain and the views are incredible. Free for students of the EU but the 20 euro admission fee is definitely worth it!

title: Amazing - a must go!
text: Really enoyed visiting all of the little streets in the old town and you can see and access all the castle walls too. Not a huge amount to do in Dubrovnik so it was nice to spend the day here

title: Amazing - a must go!
text: We had an amazing time here! Its a sandy beach and there is a pier and high rocks to jump off and an ice cream stall. There is also a bar with beanbags where you can sit - we had a great day here!

title: Amazing - a must go!
text: Amazing exhibition with so many different items in it. It has so many different stories in there from lots of different relationships. A must go - cheap admission
place: Zagreb Museum of Broken Relationships Admission Ticket

title: Amazing - a must go!
text: Really cool in there and it's huge with so many rooms!! The drinks are averagely priced, maybe a little much but its very worth going as its very trendy! usually very busy

title: Amazing - a must go!
text: Really amazing views from the top of the deck. Its pretty cheap and they have a student price. You can see slovakia, austria and hungary from there too. A must go its very good!

title: Amazing - a must go!
text: So many things to see here and the sausages are a must try - Kielbasa is amazing! lots of different foods and clothes to see

title: Amazing views - a must go to
text: Really pretty with great views in all angles. Definitely recommend to visit - there are also free walking tours which cover this bridge so that you can learn more about it!

title: Amazing - a must go!
text: Really enjoyed our experience here. We had steins which on a Monday, the day we went, are super cheap and the food was amazing. I had a traditional schnitzel (also cheap) but so tasty and huge it was bigger than the plate! Very busy with queues out the door, we didn't wait too long but I think we were very lucky so if you know you would like to go be sure to make a reservation! Great place and would 100% recommend! so traditional as they also had live music!

title: 'Cool' experience, really enjoyed it, a must do if in Oslo!
text: Really enjoyed this experience and a must-try experience. It was £17 for entry and 1 drink of a nice fruity rose but that was the student price. It is one big room with a bar and there are all different ice sculpted booths to sit in. Amazing experience and right in the centre of Oslo!

title: Very interesting and lots of fun!
text: My boyfriend and I travelled to Amsterdam and went on 3 of the free walking tours. We went on the food tour, the classic tour and the red light district tour. The food tour was guided by Marius and it was very interesting and we got to try many different foods. The tours are tip based due to them being free however and we were unsure how much to leave. We left the same amount that others on the tour left for Marius thinking that that would be fine however after being a nice, informative tour guide, he looked disgusted at the tip and did not thank us which was upsetting. However, the red light district tour was with Jacob and was really interesting and informative! We learned a lot about the district and what goes on there and he was a funny man! The classic tour was our favourite as our tour guide Lennart was funny and knew a lot about Amsterdam. He made the tour interactive and interesting, taking us round many streets in Amsterdam. Would highly recommend these tours as they really immerse you into the history and areas of Amsterdam!

title: Great fun, interesting and lots of free chocolate!
text: My boyfriend and I went to this chocolate museum (€8.50 for students, think it’s a Euro more for adult tickets) and thoroughly enjoyed it! It took longer than anticipated to complete (about 2 hours) which was great as it’s definitely value for money! It was so interesting with fun scanners for information and there’s a room where you can try all different chocolates (and as much as you want!) there was also a demonstration as to how filled chocolates are made (and a taster at the end!) which was so fun to watch! Would definitely go again if we return to Brussels and we definitely recommend!
place: Choco-Story: The Chocolate Museum in Brussels

title: Amazing food and entertainment!
text: Had an amazing time at Ellens diner, did had to wait 40 minutes outside to get in meaning that I missed the breakfast menu and went straight to lunch. Amazing atmosphere and food and the entertainment was fabulous with dancers and singers all around. Would definitely recommend that you take a very warm fluffy jacket with you though as the biting cold temperatures hit you as soon as you walk in! VERY COLD IN THERE!

title: Amazing hotel with very friendly staff and perfect location!!
text: We visited this hotel in June 2019 and thoroughly enjoyed my stay. The staff were all very friendly and answered all the many questions I had regarding local delicacies! The location is perfect and the view of the empire state from the room and the spyglass rooftop bar is excellent. Very helpful concierge and the door staff were all very helpful (served by Jonathan) Definitely will be returning!
